summary: This is a JPMorgan Chase Bank Asset Account Portfolio statement for Jeffrey Epstein covering September 1-30, 2002. It details account holdings, trade activity, and transactions, including several large wire transfers to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co., one of which was for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Primary holder of the JPMorgan Private Bank asset account detailed in this portfolio statement.

persons.name: Riley I. Hornbecker
persons.context: Listed as the Service Specialist for the account on the statement's cover page.

persons.name: Jeanne Brennan
persons.context: Named as the attention contact at Financial Trust Company for correspondence related to Jeffrey Epstein's account.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Recipient of a $5,000,000 wire transfer from Jeffrey Epstein's account to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co. on September 18, 2002.

connections.description: Epstein authorized a $5 million wire transfer from his JPMorgan account to Maxwell's attention at Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co.
Hornbecker is listed as the JPMorgan Service Specialist for Epstein's asset account.
Brennan is the designated contact at Financial Trust Company for correspondence regarding Epstein's JPMorgan account.

events.title: $2M Wire Transfer to Epstein
events.description: A $2,000,000 sale from a money market fund in Epstein's account was wired to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co. for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: $1M Wire Transfer to Epstein
events.description: A $1,000,000 sale from a money market fund in Epstein's account was wired to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co. for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: $5M Wire Transfer to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A $5,000,000 sale from a money market fund in Epstein's account was wired to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co. for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 345 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10154-1002 (JPMorgan Chase Bank address)
Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co. (Recipient bank for wire transfers)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's JPMorgan asset account held over $21.6 million in total portfolio value as of September 30, 2002.
In September 2002, Epstein's account executed three large wire transfers totaling $8 million to Palm Beach National Bank & Trust Co.
A $5 million wire transfer on September 18, 2002, was specifically directed to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The account was heavily invested in cash and short-term instruments, specifically J.P. Morgan Tax Free Money Market funds.
The document is marked as 'Confidential Treatment Requested by JPMorgan' and is a government exhibit (504) in a court case (20 Cr. 330).
